newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks slip in early morning trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks slip in early morning trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks slipped in early Thursday morning trade, dampened by signs of a strengthening yen against the dollar, brokers said. They said however that investors were continuing to buy domestic-demand related shares sporadically.
By 0019 GMT, the Nikkei average had fallen 158.41 points or 0.78 percent to 20,051.31. Its June futures fell 120 to 20,120.
"Exporters are retreating due to the stronger yen," a "Big Four" broker said. "But there is still avid interest in domestic stocks which is cushioning losses."
